body_content.explanation: (of a member of the armed forces) having achieved the rank of officer by receiving a commission (= an official order) rather than by rising from the lower ranks:
examples: On leaving Cambridge he did his military service as a commissioned officer in the Royal Engineers.
He was the first African-American to serve as a commissioned Navy officer.

body_content.explanation: A commissioned piece of work has been formally asked for by someone in authority:
examples: The piece was choreographed by Twyla Tharp to a commissioned score by Elvis Costello.
At the front of the building will be a specially commissioned sculpture.
A commissioned study of healthcare needs across the region has not yet been completed.

body_content.explanation: A commissioned person has been formally asked to produce something by a person in authority:
examples: The accompanying pictures were drawn by a commissioned artist.

body_content.explanation: A commissioned salesperson (= someone who sells things) receives payment that is directly related to the amount they sell:
examples: You're working with a commissioned salesperson who only stands to gain if he makes the deal.
